Boston.com
10

Federal regulators renew license of Pilgrim nuke plant

Plymouth's Pilgrim Nuclear Power Station will continue to operate for 20 years, despite the chairman's vote yesterday to deny the license. (Globe, 12:14 p.m.)
  • NRC chairman votes to deny license renewal for plant

Brown says Harvard falsely reported Warren's ethnicity

Senator Scott Brown accused Harvard University today of falsely reporting to the government that Elizabeth Warren was a Native American. (Globe, 11:06 a.m.)
  • Filings raise more questions on Warren's ethnic claims
  • 5/5: Debate over ancestry may haunt Warren
  • 4/30: Law directories identified Warren as minority

3 suspects face hazing-related charges

Three of the nine people facing criminal charges for the alleged hazing inside the Alpha Epsilon Pi fraternity at BU appeared in court today. (Boston Globe, 12:49 p.m.)
  • 4/10 Police seek charges against BU students

Schilling’s 38 Studios lays off entire staff

The former Red Sox pitcher’s company, which had more than 400 full-time workers and contractors, made the layoffs because of financial difficulties. (Boston Globe)
